""  ""The Chinese and trying to create a counter-narrative. . .  to shift the narrative from their initial responsibility for not fessing up to what was happening

column13: we knew something had happened.  it was very hard to get answers from China about what had happened
column16: a recurring pattern this time around.  It is probably the most troubling aspect of this crisis.    It is kind of in the nature of the Chinese system -- an authoritarian system where control of information is power
column17: control of the narrative is power
column18: so we shouldn't be surprised that when this outbreak happened in Wuhan

2020-04-17 00:00:00#world#"Pompeo On Moving 2022 Winter Olympic Games From Beijing: ""We'll Have To Take A Look At That"""#https://www.realclearpolitics.com/video/2020/04/17/pompeo_on_moving_2022_winter_olympic_games_from_beijing_well_have_to_take_a_look_at_that.html#https://assets.realclear.com/images/49/493321.jpg#en#0.0#www.realclearpolitics.com#Secretary of State Mike Pompeo joined Hugh Hewitt's radio show Friday morning to discuss the People's Republic of China
column2: the Communist Party of China and the COVID-19 virus.   HUGH HEWITT
column3: HOST: Now Mr.  Secretary
column4: I don’t know what they teach at Harvard Law
column6: they taught me that if a witness or a party lies about big things
column7: you don’t believe them on anything.  And on that theory
column8: they’ve lied about some big things.  I don’t know that I would trust them to put on the Olympic games if they told us it was safe to do it.  Do you think the Olympic games scheduled for Beijing in 2022 ought to be moved?  SECRETARY OF STATE MIKE POMPEO: We’ll have to take a look at that.  I’m really focused on today.  But Hugh
column9: you do have to go back to other things that the Chinese Communist Party has committed to.  They promised there’d be one country
column10: two systems in Hong Kong
column11: and yet they have expanded their repression there.  They’ve promised that what was going on in the west
column14: the Uighurs there in the West.  We know what’s taking place.  It’s a humanitarian catastrophe.  Xi himself in the Rose Garden promised that they wouldn’t arm islands all across the South Pacific.  They’ve done that.  They’ve put significant weaponry there.  And this is a country that the whole world needs to ensure that we watch what they do and not what they say.  They want to be a great power.  They want to join the community of civilized nations.  To do that
column17: you have to tell the truth.  That’s our expectation of the Chinese Communist Party.  And it has fallen short of that too often.   HEWITT: Doesn’t the world
column19: need to respond in a coherent way
column20: and taking back the Olympics is to me the most obvious display of condemnation of their lack of transparency
column21: Mr.  Secretary.  Are there things like that on the drawing board?  POMPEO: So I’ve been in lots of conversations over the past
column23: three weeks or four weeks with colleagues all around the world
column25: too.  He was on a call with all of these G-7 nations yesterday.  There is enormous frustration
column26: and not just with this incident
column27: but with the growing challenges presented by a Chinese Communist Party that appears intent on failing to live up to its international obligations.  I don’t know precisely what that response will be.  But the time for accountability will come.  And when we do that
column28: we need to do it in a way that reflects the full scope of the problem set
column29: not just what has occurred as a result of this pandemic
column30: but the full problem set that it has presented.  The President took it on.  He saw that we had unfair trade relationship.  We worked diligently to fix that.  There are many dimensions to this challenge in the world.  Not just the United States need to confront them in a way that delivers for the American people.
